author: Bloomberg
title: Zimbabwe rescues 15 trapped miners alive – Mines Minister
text: Zimbabwe rescues 15 trapped miners alive – Mines Minister Photo by Creamer Media As a magazine-and-online subscriber to Creamer Media's Engineering News & Mining Weekly, you are entitled to one free research report of your choice. You would have received a promotional code at the time of your subscription. Have this code ready and click [here](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/). At the time of check-out, please enter your promotional code to download your free report. Email [subscriptions@creamermedia.co.za](mailto:subscriptions@creamermedia.co.za) if you have forgotten your promotional code. If you have previously accessed your free report, you can purchase additional Research Reports by clicking on the “Buy Report” button on this page. The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). For a full list of Research Channel Africa benefits, click [here](https://cdn.creamermedia.com/e-magazines/engineering-news/ResearchChannalMay2023/index.html) If you are not a subscriber, you can either buy the individual research report by clicking on the ‘Buy Report’ button, or you can subscribe and, not only gain access to your one free report, but also enjoy all other subscriber benefits, including 1) an electronic archive of back issues of the weekly news magazine; 2) access to an industrial and mining projects browser; 3) access to a database of published articles; and 4) the ability to save articles for future reference. At the time of your subscription, Creamer Media’s subscriptions department will be in contact with you to ensure that you receive a copy of your preferred Research Report. The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). If you are a Creamer Media subscriber, click [here](javascript:void(0);) to log in. An emergency operation managed to rescue all 15 small-scale Zimbabwean gold miners who had been trapped for four days after a shaft collapsed, according to Mines Minister Soda Zhemu. ”They are all okay and very conscious,” Zhemu said in a telephone interview from Penhalonga, at the scene of the accident. The incident occurred Jan. 5 at the Redwing gold mine, which is 275 kilometers (171 miles) east of the capital, Harare, and is owned by Metallon Corp Ltd. The country produced 30.1 tons of gold in 2023, of which 60% came from small scale miners, according to Fidelity Gold Refinery, the country’s sole authorized buyer of the commodity. author: PabloPani
title: #36 La ineficiencia de Milei
text:
[BiRDo](/user/BiRDo)a [youtube.com](/go/link/3969416) [#16](c16#c-16) Ese truqui contable de Milei de llevarse el pago de intereses del banco central al tesoro me tiene dando volteretas. Y luego claro, el pago de intereses no figura en el cálculo de superávit fiscal y por arte de magia desaparece.
Dices que no se emiten pesos desde junio, (me gustaría ver tu fuente), pero como crees que el BC consigue buena parte de sus dólares? Obviamente creando pesos para luego intercambiarlos por dólares.
Que la deuda privada es beneficiosa? Por dios lo que hay que leer. Las empresas y familias argentinas están pidiendo créditos para poder sobrevivir en su día a día porque el gobierno les ha exprimido tanto que con sus ingresos no les da. Eso es pan para hoy hambre para mañana.
Argentina es un país normal con un 55% de pobres?
Con un hundimiento industrial nunca visto desde la pandemia? (Adjunto gráfica)
Y se podría seguir y seguir...
[#18](c18#c-18) Argentina tiene superávit absoluto, es decir fiscal, no sólo primario. Es decir, tiene superávit incluso contando el pago de intereses.
¿Argentina, era un país normal con un 48% de pobres? Sobre el hundimiento, será en el sector industrial, pero muchos otros sectores están en aumento (energía, coches, agricultura...).
El BC consigue dólares al menos por dos formas. Una porque el gobierno tiene superávit. Otra porque cuando hacer eso de emitir pesos y luego recomprarlos con la exportación, lo hace a tasas de cambio diferenciales (sigue existiendo el cepo cambiario y el banco central obviamente se aprovecha) y se queda la diferencia (en dólares, ya que no emite pesos netamente).
[#30](c30#c-30) A mí qué me cuentas de Macri, ese zurdito que siempre tuvo déficit, Milei evitó una hiperinflación así que evitó una herencia del 95% de pobres.
Si Milei arregla algo, que dudo mucho que mejore algún dato económico, será a base de malvender el país, hacer más ricos a los ricos y empobrecer a mucha gente. Milei es un inútil que no vale ni para estar escondido y el que lo ha votado es un idiota, porque la desesperación no me vale, que al idiota este se le veía venir
La inflación sube (más aún): Milei está destruyendo el país!.
La inflación baja: "es que el que la inflación baje es una MUY mala señal!"
Dudo que el hombre que habla con el espíritu de su perro sea capaz de arreglar algo, pero digo lo de siempre Milei es el RESULTADO de la situación de Argentina, no la causa. El pueblo desesperado se ha arrojado a sus brazos por la desesperada situación. Tratar de culparlo por lo que ha hecho en 6 meses es absurdo por algo generado durante décadas.
[#5](c5#c-5) Milei no es la causa, pero es lo de siempre: querer solucionar los problemas sin atajar el origen de los mismos. En una economía consumista, como la de Argentina (o la nuestra), si los consumidores no tienen dinero, la demanda baja. La desigualdad es el origen del problema, y la solución son medidas redistributivas (hay muchas formas de hacer esto, no se trata necesariamente de subvencionar, lo cuál tampoco funciona a medio o largo plazo). Todo lo demás son cuentos.
[#12](c12#c-12) obviamente Milei está interviniendo como un vulgar zurdo para estabilizar el tipo de cambio del dolar blue. Y para conseguirlo está desdolarizando el BC. Cuando se quede sin reservas nos vamos a reír.
Que Milei no quiere emitir pesos? Está emitiendo pesos más rápido que cualquiera de sus antecesores.
[#14](c14#c-14) Milei emitía pesos netamente hasta Junio. Desde entonces ya no lo hace, netamente. Hasta junio fue por la herencia recibida (los Pases y los puts). Desde junio, netamente ya no se emite ni un peso, porque como he explicado en #_12 todo lo que emite via exportaciones, automáticamente lo recompra y elimina. Así que, sí, está emitiendo, pero no estás contando que está recomprando y eliminando todo lo que emite.
Y sobre la base monetaria amplia, AFORTUNADAMENTE está aumentando. De forma natural y beneficiosa. Por el CRÉDITO PRIVADO, cosa que ni existía con el anterior gobierno. En un país normal la base monetaria amplia debería ser equivalente al 100% del PIB o más, y en Argentina era sólo el 5% porque no había crédito porque nadie se fiaba del gobierno. Sí, la base monetaria amplia va a seguir aumentando, gracias a que los bancos ahora sí están concediendo hipotecas, por ejemplo. Hasta ahora y durante más de 20 años, la única forma de comprar vivienda era con maletines llenos de dólares, en cash. Gracias a Milei eso ha cambiado y Argentina empieza a ser un país normal.
[#14](c14#c-14)
Hay otro ahora, el dólar MEP. Es como un cambio en diferido compras activos en pesos y al cabo de un tiempo te ingresan los dólares (entiendo que el riesgo te lo comes tú)
[#23](c23#c-23) La teoría monetaria moderna no tiene en cuenta la demanda/oferta de dinero. Por tanto no explica absolutamente nada.
Sobre la inflación, que yo sepa el precio de las casas y la bolsa subieron mucho durante ese período en el que dices que no hubo inflación en la UE. Nota: la inflación se puede medir de muchas formas, no sólo a través del IPC (precios de consumo).
Cuando los peronistas hundían al país no veía a esta gente quejándose. Lo cierto es que la senda de la inflación va cada vez más a la baja (compárese con la que tenían hace seis meses) y el cepo puede quitarse en cualquier momento.
[#15](c15#c-15) será más bien porque Milei decidió como primera medida gubernamental devaluar el peso un 50%.
Ese 25,5% es franquicia milei.
[#21](c21#c-21) ¿En serio pones un vídeo del inepto de Eduardo Garzón? ¿Ese que dice que emitir dinero a mansalva no crea inflación?
[#2](c2#c-2) Ese 4% mensual es el número más bajo en los últimos 30 meses. Eso es un hecho. Este "periodista" habla de ineficiencia pero el último mes de Massa fue con un 12.6% mensual de inflación.
[#8](c8#c-8) lo ha comparado con el mismo mes de otros, no con el último de Masa ( sabemos que los precios tienen estacionalidad) , y ha deslizado un posible fallo estadístico, aclarando que no es tramposo ( el fallo); básicamente he entendido que con un shock de demanda la cesta de referencia que se usa puede no estar reflejando correctamente la subida de los precios; añade, además, que los recursos se están invirtiendo en sostener la moneda, conscientes del brutal efecto inflacionario de la devaluación por la importancia que tienen las importaciones en el consumidor argentino, lo cual, según el comentarista, es prueba de que Caputo no cree en el dogma monetarista de Milei.
[#10](c10#c-10) Lo que dice es falso, no se está usando ningún recurso para soportar la moneda. Al revés, lo que pasa es que hay que entender cómo funciona actualmente el banco central.
Te lo explico, actualmente hay cepo cambiario y entre otras cosas eso significa que como empresa, para importar o exportar, de por ley, tienes que pasar por el banco central. Cuando una empresa exporta, de por ley, el banco central emite pesos (que da al exportador) a cambio de los dólares que el banco central recibe. Como Milei no quiere emitir pesos de ninguna manera, acto seguido el banco central vuelve recomprar (y eliminar) esos pesos en el mercado secundario (ej CCL) con los dólares recibidos. Así, netamente no ha aumentado la cantidad de pesos. Este periodista se está centrando en la segunda parte para contar que se está "interviniendo" el precio del dólar, pero la realidad es que esa segunda parte es simplemente esterilizar los pesos creados por la exportación.
[#13](c13#c-13) Normal, había inflación escondida bajo la alfombra, es decir una brecha entre el dólar real/negro y el oficial de más del 200%. Ese 25.5% era inflación de Massa, no de Milei.

author: Артём Краснов
title: Турмаршруты вдоль Байкала: «Заповедное Прибайкалье» закрыло семь популярных маршрутов из Листвянки по ББТ, до Камня Черского и в Порт Байкал - 8 мая 2025 | ИРСИТИ.ру
text:
В Прибайкальском национальном парке из-за высоких классов пожарной опасности прямо перед вторыми длинными майскими выходными закрыли восемь популярных туристических маршрутов. Выдачу разрешений на их посещение приостановили, а без этого документа выходить на эти маршруты запрещено, ограничение действует с 5 мая.
Как сообщает пресс-служба «Заповедного Прибайкалья», сейчас для туристов закрыты следующие направления: вся Большая Байкальская тропа от поселка Листвянка до поселка Большое Голоустное, поселок Порт Байкал и маршрут из Порта Байкал к истоку реки Ангара, трек до Камня Черского в Листвянке. Также нельзя ходить из Листвянки до Пади Крестовой и Пади Черной.
Наконец, закрыты для туристов маршрут «236 кв — поселок Щеглова», который начинается на 48-м километре Байкальского тракта и заканчивается на берегу Ангары, и маршрут из деревни Большая Речка к реке Черемшанка.
Кроме того, 6 мая был закрыт вдоль Кругобайкальской железной дороги, но не только из-за пожарной опасности, а еще из-за медведя. Специалисты нацпарка обнаружили на 124-м километре тушу изюбря, которой время от времени лакомился хищник.
«Медведь регулярно наведывается к мясу, ест его и охраняет свою „добычу“ от других претендентов (за которых может принять и человека!). Перенести тушу подальше от трека движения пеших посетителей национального парка не представляется возможным, так как она уже имеет высокую степень разложения», — рассказали специалисты.
Поэтому маршрут закрыли для туристов до тех пор, пока хищник не доест свой провиант и не уйдет дальше.
В «Заповедном Прибайкалье» напомнили, что эта мера должна защитить леса от пожаров. Кроме того, есть вероятность, что может быть закрыт для посещения маршрут на север острова Ольхон.
«По данным специалистов, запрет на посещение национального парка по отдельным маршрутам может продлиться до нескольких суток: солнечная и ветреная погода, отсутствие осадков и обилие сухой прошлогодней растительности являются факторами, провоцирующими появление и разгул огненной стихии. Источником пламени могут стать не только разведённый костёр, а просто брошенный окурок или стеклянный мусор», — говорится в сообщении.

author: Jiani Navarro
title: Fierce winds from storm causes tree damage, ignites house fire in Overland Park
text:
JOHNSON COUNTY, Kan. (KCTV) - Many are still feeling the impacts from the storm that swept across the Kansas City metro late Tuesday.
Crews and residents got a better look at the damage Wednesday morning after high winds and snow.
“The wind was crazy,” said Victoria Shelton, who lives in Lenexa.
Shelton and her family couldn’t open their front door. Wind gusts completely uprooted the tree in their front yard, blocking them in.
“Around like 2, 3 a.m. I heard a loud boom, and it startled me out of bed,” she said, “when I woke up this morning and saw it, I was kind of shocked.”
Evergy crews were out fixing power lines, as nearly 190,000 residents were without power after the storm.
Meanwhile, tree removal crews wasted no time cutting through the mess as calls continued to come in throughout the morning.
“With all the saturation with the rain that we had yesterday, leaving to this red wood here, there was a root system that was failing,” said Will Garner, with Timber Tree Service LLC, “not to mention all the high winds and all there was a lot of wait from this wet snow that basically caused it to tip over and up root.”
Across town in Overland Park a large tree snapped, falling over onto a powerline, causing a house fire.
In Overland Park a large tree snapped, falling over onto a powerline, causing a house fire. (KCTV5) “The wind was blowing straight out of the north, blowing this way and it just literally snapped it off about 6-8 foot up and its laying across my fence,” said Mike Hyde.
Hyde said his neighbor’s home, that belongs to an elderly woman in her mid-90′s was inside.
He said smoke was coming from her garage and wasn’t able to walk, so the neighbor across the street ran in to save her.
“Her smoke alarm went off, but she had no power she was disoriented in her house, he said, “Andy went in quickly, got her, carried her over to his house across the street.”
Hyde explained it was a freighting situation and happened all so quick, but is just glad everyone is okay and pushes everyone to check their trees.
“It snapped it off like a twig, so yeah that’s probably a good thing, if you think you got trees that are damaged, I would definitely probably look to have them cut down or trimmed up,” he said.”
Copyright 2025 KCTV. All rights reserved.

author: Resumen Latinoamericano
title: Nación Mapuche. En Wawel Niyeo (Jacobacci) hay responsables de la explotación minería que mata vidas
text:
Resumen Latinoamericano, 7 de mayo de 2025
En Wawel Niyeo (Jacobacci), hay muchos vecinos y vecinas que son testigos del daño que producen la explotación minera en los territorios, matando todas las vidas.
Autoridades, empresas, gobiernos, fiscales y jueces son responsables o cómplices.
asambleawawelniyeo

author: Will Kennedy
title: Recap: South Dakota State football rolls over Montana for FCS title
text: RECAP: South Dakota State football earns second straight national title with win over Montana [Will Kennedy](https://www.desmoinesregister.com/staff/4291603001/will-kennedy/) The South Dakota State football team won its second-straight national title on Sunday with a massive win over Montana. The Jackrabbits dominated in the second half to pull away from the Grizzlies. Re-live all the fun and action here in our live blog. Check out our early game story Check out our early game story from Frisco. It will be updated with more info after press conferences and the trophy presentation. More: [South Dakota State football dominates Montana, wins second-straight FCS national title](/story/sports/college/south-dakota-state-university/2024/01/07/south-dakota-state-football-takes-down-montana-wins-fcs-national-title-consecutive-ncaa-frisco-texas/72088965007/) FINAL: South Dakota State 23, Montana 3 Jackrabbits win their second straight national title. 4Q/4:53 Montana punts it back to SDSU A three-and-out gives the ball back to the Jackrabbits. That should just about do it. 4Q/5:14 Montana gets the ball back SDSU offense can't get much going and will punt back to the Griz. Montana needs to do something, and fast, if they want a chance here. Jackrabbits up 23-3 4Q/8:07 Montana punts the ball With the Griz down by 20 points and time ticking away, they opt to punt the ball back to SDSU. Seems a bit like waving the white flag there. SDSU starts with the ball at their own 31. Jackrabbits lead 23-3 4Q/11:10 Montana can't convert on fourth down The Jackrabbits get off the field thanks to a stop on fourth-and-19. SDSU's offense will take back over from their own 21. SDSU just over 11 minutes away from their second straight national title. Any points on this drive should just about ice it. SDSU up 23-3 END OF THIRD QUARTER: South Dakota State 23, Montana 3 3Q/0:56 Hunter Dustman nails a FG to extend SDSU's lead The Jackrabbits couldn't find the end zone after the fumble, but they did add points. Hunter Dustman drills a 32-yard field goal to move the Jackrabbits' lead to 20 points. SDSU up 23-3. 3Q/2:22 SDSU forces another turnover On Montana's first offensive play after the turnover, SDSU gets a sack and knocks the ball out. Jackrabbits recover and will start this drive on the Montana 21. 3Q/2:36 Another touchdown for South Dakota State Mark Gronowski drops a beautiful pass to Jadon Janke into the front corner of the end zone for another Jackrabbits touchdown. That put a cap on a six-play, 59-yard drive. A bobbled snap on the PAT means it's a 20-3 SDSU lead. 3Q/7:11 Mark Gronowski finds the end zone The Jackrabbits extend their lead thanks to a designed run for Gronowski from 10 yards out. The scamper ended a five-play, 58-yard drive. The biggest play was when Gronowski found his tight end, Zach Heins for 34 yards on third down. One play later the QB found the end zone. SDSU up 14-3. 3Q/10:56 Jackrabbits can't get anything off turnover SDSU goes three and out but get a big punt from Hunter Dustman to pin the Griz back at their own 5. 3Q/12:58 SDSU forces its first turnover of the day Montana was moving the ball well to start the half. Aaron Fontes caught a ball over the middle and made a few SDSU defenders miss. But he made one too many moves and a Jackrabbit defender knocked the ball out from behind while making a tackle. Jackrabbits recovered near midfield and will look to extend their lead. 3Q/14:56 We're back underway Montana gets the ball at their own 24 after the kickoff return. Just 30 more minutes of football in the 2023 season. HALFTIME: South Dakota State 7, Montana 3 Montana gets the ball to start the second half. 2Q/1:52 Turnover doesn't hurt SDSU The Jackrabbits get off the field again and force a punt. SDSU will have the ball at their own 13 to begin this drive. They've got three timeouts to burn too. That's important to note since Montana gets the ball first in the second half. SDSU up 7-3. 2Q/4:12 South Dakota State turns it over again After giving up one first down, the Jackrabbits defense gets off the field. But the ensuing punt takes an unlucky bounce and hits off an SDSU blocker. Montana recovers the ball and takes over right around midfield. 2Q/7:49 SDSU drive stalls, but Jackrabbits pin Montana deep The Jackrabbits had a few nice plays on that possession, but they weren't able to get into scoring range. That's all well and good for punter Hunter Dustman, though. He gets off a boot away from dangerous Griz return man Junior Bergen and pins Montana back at their own 5-yard line. 2Q/10:51 Montana eats into SDSU's lead After getting a short field thanks to the interception, the Montana offense can't do much. They're forced to settle for a 30-yard field goal attempt, which Nico Ramos drills. SDSU up 7-3 and getting the ball back. 2Q/13:24 SDSU turns the ball over SDSU QB Mark Gronowski made a rare mistake, tossing the ball into danger. It was picked off by Montana's Corbin Walker and returned into Jackrabbits territory. Q2/14:39 SDSU defense stands tall On fourth-and-goal from inside the one, the Griz run an end around and it appears like the Jackrabbits stop it. There was no review on the play and the SDSU offense is already off and running. SDSU up 7-0 and driving. END OF FIRST QUARTER: South Dakota State 7, Montana 0 That's the end of a very quick opening quarter. SDSU scored on its only possession. Montana got a big return on the following kickoff and drove right down the field too. The Griz face a fourth-and-goal from inside the one-yard-line when the second quarter begins. 1Q/8:08 Isaiah Davis finds the end zone South Dakota State marched down the field with ease on that opening drive, converting on two third-downs. Davis punctuated the drive with a six-yard touchdown to the left side. He was untouched and was able to walk into the end zone. Jackrabbits up 7-0. 1Q/13:38 Jaxon Janke with a big play Mark Gronowski dumps off a short pass to his right and Janke breaks a few tackles to take it 27 yards into Montana territory. 1Q/15:00 Just about set for kickoff Montana wins the toss and elects to defer. That means the Jackrabbits will start the game on offense. Lock in, everybody. 12:30 p.m. Check out the field-level view We're just about 30 minutes away from kickoff in Frisco. Check out this video our reporter in Texas took of the field-level view during warmups. 12:00 p.m. Everything is looking beautiful out in Texas Our lead sports reporter, Jonathan Fernandez, has arrived at the stadium and is ready for the game. Check out the paint job on the field. Looks pretty great with SDSU's checkerboards on one side and Montana's iconic maroon on the other. Just about an hour until kickoff now. 11:30 a.m. Check out our coverage from Frisco Our reporters have been hard at work all week putting together stories about this Jackrabbits team heading into this afternoon's big game. Check out all the links to every story we've written since arriving on-site in Frisco earlier this week. author: Silvia Turin
title: Il «fegato grasso» non dà sintomi ma è molto pericoloso: come scoprire di averlo
text:
metabolismo
Il «fegato grasso» non dà sintomi ma è molto pericoloso: come scoprire di averlo
La steatosi epatica è più comune di quel che si pensa: colpisce fino al 33% degli adulti e mette a rischio soprattutto il cuore. Può averla anche chi è magro: come diagnosticarla e come far «dimagrire il fegato»
Una volta si riteneva che il «fegato grasso» (una condizione chiamata in medicina [steatosi epatica](https://www.corriere.it/salute/dizionario/steatosi/)), non richiedesse particolare attenzione. Ora si sa invece che è uno dei principali attori nella cosiddetta sindrome metabolica, una condizione che non solo coinvolge quest’organo importantissimo, ma espone al rischio di sviluppare diabete di tipo II, con tutte le sue complicanze, e aumenta la probabilità di malattie cardiovascolari, che possono esitare in eventi come infarti e ictus.
Ne abbiamo parlato al [Tempo della Salute 2024 ](https://www.corriere.it/salute/tempo-della-salute/)in un incontro a cura di Luigi Ripamonti con Anna Ludovica Fracanzani, direttore SC Medicina ad Indirizzo Metabolico Policlinico di Milano e professore di Medicina Interna all’Università degli Studi di Milano.[QUI il programma completo delle 4 giornate del Tempo della Salute 2024 online su Corriere.it e in presenza al Palazzo dei Giureconsulti in Duomo a Milano. ](https://www.corriere.it/salute/tempo-della-salute/2024/programma/)
Molto comune
La steatosi è molto comune, si stima riguardi dal 25 al 33% degli adulti. La steatosi epatica non alcolica (cioè non dovuta a consumo di bevande alcoliche) può essere una condizione genetica (non di rado ci sono già stati casi in famiglia) oppure può essere legata ad alcuni fattori metabolici: «Essere sovrappeso — ha elencato Fracanzani —, avere una disposizione del grasso differente soprattutto nelle viscere (si misura con la circonferenza vita che non deve superare nelle donne adulte gli 80 cm e i 94 cm nell’uomo), pressione alta, trigliceridi (non sopra i 150 mg/dl), colesterolo buono non troppo basso e diabete».
Cosa accade
Il tessuto adiposo secerne, è un organo endocrino, che fa aumentare il livello di infiammazione. Posizionato attorno agli organi, può avvolgerli troppo e soffocarli.
Quando «ingrassa», il fegato quindi attiva «una progressiva infiammazione (in questo caso si parla di Nash o Mash, acronimi inglesi che possono essere tradotti in italiano con “steatoepatite non alcolica”), con distruzione delle cellule epatiche, che vengono progressivamente sostituite da tessuto fibroso, che può creare le premesse per la cirrosi epatica», ha spiegato l’esperta. La fibrosi è una specie di cicatrice che soffoca le cellule, la cirrosi a sua volta può anche portare allo sviluppo di un tumore del fegato.
Niente sintomi
Il problema può essere rappresentato dal fatto che il fegato «non si lamenta» e quindi non ci si accorge che sta «ingrassando», almeno negli stadi in cui non sono ancora intervenute le sue conseguenze.
Molti pazienti hanno già manifestazioni cardiovascolari quando lo scoprono: sono mandati dal cardiologo. I medici di medicina generale hanno un ruolo importante perché possono intercettare i pazienti a rischio: sopra i 50 anni, obesi, con pressione alta, magari diabete… Bisogna cercare il «fegato grasso» con gli esami del sangue.
La diagnosi
«La diagnosi, quando c’è un sospetto, è facile e indolore — chiarisce la Professoressa —. In genere lo si può sospettare con un normalissimo esame del sangue in cui i valori degli enzimi epatici (le transaminasi) sono alterati. L’esame che decreta la presenza di steatosi poi è l’ecografia epatica, che può stabilire se e quanto il fegato è «infarcito». In caso di effettiva steatosi si procede di solito con un esame ulteriore, sempre indolore, che serve a capire se si è sviluppata fibrosi. A questo scopo lo strumento più diffuso è il Fibroscan, che si basa sull’invio di onde elastiche attraverso una sonda appoggiata sul torace.
Dal momento che la steatosi epatica può rientrare nel quadro della sindrome metabolica, con conseguente rischio cardiovascolare spesso viene eseguito anche un eco-doppler delle carotidi («tronchi sovraortici») per verificare la presenza di placche aterosclerotiche.
Cosa fare
La buona notizia è che la steatosi patica può essere reversibile e il grasso nel fegato molto ridotto con un adeguato stile di vita, che prevede: riduzione del peso corporeo, quando presente, una dieta adeguata (che ricalca sostanzialmente la [dieta mediterranea](https://www.corriere.it/salute/nutrizione/23_luglio_26/vera-dieta-mediterranea-come-si-fa-scheda-a292b8de-2adc-11ee-8e96-a497dd857d5f.shtml)) ed esercizio fisico commisurato ad età e caratteristiche di ciascuno. «È importante adeguare le quantità di cibo al bisogno e migliorare la qualità — consiglia Fracanzani —. [La piramide alimentare ](https://www.corriere.it/salute/nutrizione/23_luglio_25/piramide-alimentare-dieta-mediterranea-02224ef8-2acf-11ee-8e96-a497dd857d5f.shtml)della dieta mediterranea ci dà l’idea della frequenza di consumo dei vari alimenti. L’attività fisica giusta è quella che si fa, almeno mezz’ora al giorno. La moderazione ci deve guidare».
Nel caso queste misure non bastino oggi ci sono farmaci che, quando indicati, possono essere di molto aiuto anche in casi per i quali fino a qualche tempo fa non si poteva fare nulla. In particolare si possono curare tutti i fattori di rischio cardio-metabolici come pressione, colesterolo, diabete, trigliceridi.

author: Livemint
title: Assam ‘paves way for Uniform Civil Code’, scraps Muslim Marriage Act | Mint
text: The Assam Cabinet took a significant stride in prohibiting child marriage within the state by repealing the 'Assam Muslim Marriages and Divorces Registration Act, 1935.Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma termed the Act as ‘age-old’, and said on X that this decision signals a significant advancement in the efforts to prohibit child marriages in Assam.\"On February 23, the Assam cabinet made a significant decision to repeal the age-old Assam Muslim Marriages and Divorces Registration Act. This act contained provisions allowing marriage registration even if the bride and groom had not reached the legal ages of 18 and 21, as required by law. This move marks another significant step towards prohibiting child marriages in Assam,\" Assam CM said.The state government mentioned after repealing the law, “District Commissioners and District Registrars will be authorised to take custody of registration records currently in the custody of 94 Muslim Marriage Registrars on the repeal of the legislation under the overall supervision, guidance and control of the Inspector General of Registration.”According to the 2011 Census, Muslims make up 34% of Assam's population, totalling 1.06 crore individuals out of a total population of 3.12 crore.The Assam Government has announced a one-time compensation of ₹2 lakh for Muslim Marriage Registrars to support their rehabilitation following the repeal of the Act.As reported by the Indian Express citing, state Minister Jayanta Malla Baruah said it was “a colonial act and a very important step in the journey towards a Uniform Civil Code in the state.\"Additionally, the government cited the obsolescence of the pre-Independence British-era law, which was originally formulated for the Province of Assam, as the primary reason for its repeal.“Registration of marriages and divorces is not mandatory as per the Act and the machinery of registration is informal, leaving a lot of scope for non-compliance of extant norms,” the state government noted.Meanwhile, as per provisions of the Act, “there remains scope for registering marriages of intended persons below 21 years (for males) and 18 years (for females) and there is hardly any monitoring for implementation of the Act,” the state government said. (With inputs from ANI)

author: time news
title: the conditions of President Tebboune’s visit to France “not suitable”
text:
2023-12-29 00:14:29
Emmanuel Macron and Abdelmadjid Tebboune after a press conference at the presidential palace, in Algiers, August 25, 2022. LUDOVIC MARIN / AFP
The state visit of Algerian President Abdelmadjid Tebboune to France is “always subject to preparation”affirmed the Algerian Minister of Foreign Affairs, specifying that it depends on the settlement of five files.
“In all sincerity, the conditions of this visit are not suitable”, declared Ahmed Attaf in an interview given Wednesday, December 28 evening to Atheer, the platform of the Qatari channel Al-Jazeera. Mr. Attaf listed the issues of memory, mobility, economic cooperation, French nuclear tests in the Algerian Sahara and that of the restitution of the sword as well as the burnous of Emir Abdelkader.
Even though “the president had to go to the Château d’Amboise where the Emir Abdelkader was imprisoned (…) the French authorities refused [de restituer l’épée et le burnous de l’émir] arguing the need for a law »said the minister.
Read also: French and Algerian historians relaunch the memorial dialogue in Constantine
“We continue to work”
Concerning the French nuclear tests, Mr. Attaf declared that Algeria requested “an acknowledgment of the damage caused” as well as “compensation”. Between 1960 and 1966, France carried out seventeen nuclear tests on the sites of Reggane, then In Ekker, in the Algerian Sahara. Documents declassified in 2013 revealed significant radioactive fallout that stretched from West Africa to southern Europe.
“We have not reached agreements on five major and heavy issues. But we continue to work on it”reiterated the minister, emphasizing that meetings between officials of the two countries are continuing to prepare for this state visit.
At the beginning of August, the Algerian president, Abdelmadjid Tebboune, declared that his visit to France was “always maintained” but depended ” from the program “ of the Elysée, specifying that a “state visit has conditions” et “is not a tourist visit”.
The stay, first scheduled for the beginning of May, had been postponed until June, the Algerians fearing that it would be spoiled by the May 1 demonstrations against the highly contested pension reform in France, according to consistent sources. This visit was to mark the improvement between the two countries after numerous diplomatic crises.
#conditions #President #Tebbounes #visit #France #suitable

author: University of St. Thomas
title: Chloe Bennett makes prestigious Player-of-the-Year watchlist
text: Standout student athlete Chloe Bennett makes prestigious Player-of-the-Year watchlist Ninety-eight student athletes from across the country, including UST-Houston sophomore Chloe Bennett, were named to the prestigious 2024 Tucci/NFCA Division III Pitcher and Player of the Year watchlist on April 18. The list is separated into the 10 NCAA regions, with up to 15 student athletes per region. The list is compiled by the elected members of the NFCA Division III All-America Committee with one head coach representing each of the 10 NCAA regions. Click [HERE](https://nfca.org/web_docs/awards/TUCCI-NFCA-D3-Player-Pitcher-List-2024.pdf) to view watchlist. As you scroll to Region X, you'll come across Bennett’s name. Throughout the season, this standout sophomore has been a linchpin in the Celts lineup, showcasing remarkable consistency and skill. Across all 28 games played, Bennett boasts an impressive batting average of .494 and an on-base percentage of .535. She has launched 4 home runs and driven in 36 runs, resulting in a slugging percentage of .798 and a total of 78 bases earned. Bennett's performance has been nothing short of reliable, securing hits in 24 games and multiple hits in 15. Bennett's efforts haven't gone unnoticed, earning her the prestigious hitter of the week title from the SCAC in February. Beyond her offensive prowess, Bennett has excelled defensively, tallying 127 putouts as a catcher. Her contributions have been instrumental in bolstering the Celts' defense, which ranks third in strikeouts and second in hits allowed. “It is exciting that our student athletes are starting to get recognized nationally,” Softball Head Coach Angela Froboese added. “This is a well-deserved recognition for Chloe!” Voted on by the NFCA’s Division III All-American Committee, the 2024 Tucci/NFCA Player and Pitcher of the Year winners will be announced on June 7 following the conclusion of the NCAA Division III Finals. All student athletes are eligible for the end-of-the-season awards and do not have to be on this list to be considered.
